Description: Rim and neck sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery krater; glazed mostly fired red-brown; white slip; interior: streaky glaze with traces of one, possibly two bands in added white; on top of rim, guilloche; on edge, solid squares alternating with vertical lines; underside of rim mostly painted; on neck, to left, black zone, presumably near handle area; to right, black-figure decoration consisting of boar (back, ribs, and haunches remaining) to right with added red; single incised blob rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Written in ink 'NAU 2' on break (accession number used in clay analysis). According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p.80 NAU2) the geochemical characteristics of the fabric point to an origin in the region of Teos.
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78, 80, 82-83, fig. 1) (Nau 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.555)
